class.name: BigInt
class.brief_description: Big number class for use in idle / incremental games.
class.description: A RefCounted class designed to handle very large numbers that exceed the limits of standard integer and float types. It uses a mantissa and exponent representation to store numbers, allowing for a vast range of values commonly needed in idle or incremental games.

method.name: divide
method.description: Divides this BigInt by a number and returns a new BigInt result. The argument [param n] can be a BigInt, float, int, or String.

method.name: divide_equals
method.description: Divides this BigInt by a number in-place. The argument [param n] can be a BigInt, float, int, or String.

method.name: floor_value
method.description: Rounds this BigInt down to the nearest whole integer.

method.name: is_equal_to
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the number is equal to input [param n].

method.name: is_greater_than
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the number is greater than input [param n].

method.name: is_greater_than_or_equal_to
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the number is greater than or equal to input [param n].

method.name: is_less_than
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the number is less than input [param n].

method.name: is_less_than_or_equal_to
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the number is less than or equal to input [param n].

method.name: ln
method.description: Returns the natural logarithm (base e) of this BigInt.

method.name: log10
method.description: Returns the base-10 logarithm of this BigInt.

method.name: minus
method.description: Subtracts a number from this BigInt and returns a new BigInt result. The argument [param n] can be a BigInt, float, int, or String.

method.name: minus_equals
method.description: Subtracts a number from this BigInt in-place. The argument [param n] can be a BigInt, float, int, or String.

method.name: mod
method.description: Returns the modulo of this BigInt by a number. The argument [param n] can be a BigInt, float, int, or String.

method.name: multiply
method.description: Multiplies this BigInt by a number and returns a new BigInt result. The argument [param n] can be a BigInt, float, int, or String.

method.name: multiply_equals
method.description: Multiplies this BigInt by a number in-place. The argument [param n] can be a BigInt, float, int, or String.

method.name: normalize
method.description: Normalizes the BigInt number, ensuring the mantissa is between 1.0 (inclusive) and 10.0 (exclusive), adjusting the exponent accordingly. This is called automatically by most operations.

method.name: plus
method.description: Adds a number to this BigInt and returns a new BigInt result. The argument [param n] can be a BigInt, float, int, or String.

method.name: plus_equals
method.description: Adds a number to this BigInt in-place. The argument [param n] can be a BigInt, float, int, or String.

method.name: power
method.description: Raises this BigInt to a power and returns a new BigInt result.

method.name: power_equals
method.description: Raises this BigInt to a power in-place.

method.name: square_root
method.description: Returns the square root of this BigInt as a new BigInt.

method.name: to_float
method.description: Converts this BigInt to a float. Warning: Standard floats have limited precision and range.

members.member: The exponent part of the scientific notation representation (e.g., the '5' in 1.23e5).
The mantissa (significand) part of the scientific notation representation (e.g., the '1.23' in 1.23e5). Normalization keeps this value between 1.0 and 10.0 for non-zero numbers.
